dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty specific change—Aktobe civil servants shifting to an 8:30 to 5:30 schedule.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty specific change-Aktobe civil servants shifting to an eight thirty to five thirty schedule.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new schedule sets working hours from 08:30 to 17:30.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it was the regional akim, Askhat Shakharov, who signed off on it, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and apparently over 70% of employees actually supported this in an internal survey.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, that's a pretty high approval rate. I guess people really wanted that earlier start.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, that's a pretty high approval rate. I guess people really wanted that earlier start.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? They mentioned it'll help with efficiency and service quality for citizens too.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The changes aim to increase the efficiency of public services and improve service quality for citizens," Kobeeva added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the lunch break is getting shorter as well—just one hour now, from 12:30 to 1:30.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the lunch break is getting shorter as well-just one hour now, from twelve thirty to one thirty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lunch break will be from 12:30 to 1:30 ," Kobeeva told a Tengrinews.kz correspondent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, compared to their current break which goes till 2 PM. That's a solid trim.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think starting earlier actually makes people more productive, or is it just symbolic?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think starting earlier actually makes people more productive, or is it just symbolic?

dialogue_turns.text: I mean, if the majority of staff are on board, it might really streamline things, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, and Gulbagda Kobeeva, the press secretary, made it sound like it was a collective decision.

dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—government work hours don't usually change that often.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I wonder if other regions might follow suit if this works well in Aktobe.

dialogue_turns.text: Could be! Adjusting public service hours to maybe align better with when people need things.

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—imagine finishing errands earlier because offices close at 5:30 instead of 6:30.
